com.sitemorse.sci

Class SCIClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sitemorse.sci.SCIClient

  • public class SCIClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Implement the Sitemorse CMS Integration (SCI) Client protocol.
    Version:
    1.1.4
    Author:
    Sitemorse (UK Sales) Ltd

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SCIClient(java.lang.String licenceKey)
      Construct an SCIClient object with the specified licence key, and default connection parameters.
      SCIClient(java.lang.String licenceKey, java.lang.String serverHostname)
      Construct an SCIClient object with the specified licence key, using the specified host name to connect to the SCI server.
      SCIClient(java.lang.String licenceKey, java.lang.String serverHostname, int serverPort)
      Construct an SCIClient object with the specified licence key, using the specified host name and port to connect to the SCI server.
      SCIClient(java.lang.String licenceKey, java.lang.String serverHostname, int serverPort, boolean serverSecure)
      Construct an SCIClient object with the specified licence key, using the specified host name and port to connect to the SCI server, and setting whether or not to use SSL to connect.

        Parameters:
        licenceKey - The SCI licence key.
        serverHostname - The host name to use to connect.
        serverPort - The TCP port number to use to connect.

      • SCIClient

        public SCIClient(java.lang.String licenceKey,
                 java.lang.String serverHostname,
                 int serverPort,
                 boolean serverSecure)
        Construct an SCIClient object with the specified licence key, using the specified host name and port to connect to the SCI server, and setting whether or not to use SSL to connect.
        Parameters:
        licenceKey - The SCI licence key.
        serverHostname - The host name to use to connect.
        serverPort - The TCP port number to use to connect.
        serverSecure - true to use SSL when connecting to the SCI server.

        Parameters:

      • getSciProxyHostname

        public java.lang.String getSciProxyHostname()
        Get the host name of the HTTP proxy server we will tunnel SCI connections through.
        Returns:
        the host name, or null if we are not using a proxy.

        Set the TCP port number of the HTTP proxy server to tunnel the SCI connection through.
        Parameters:
        sciProxyPort - the sciProxyPort to set

      • getSciProxyPort

        public int getSciProxyPort()
        Get the TCP port number of the HTTP proxy server we will tunnel SCI connections through.
        Returns:
        the port number

      • setExtraHeaders

        public void setExtraHeaders(java.lang.String[] extraHeaders)
        Sets extra HTTP headers to send with each request that is proxied through this class. Each string in the array should be an RFC-822-style header, with no newline or carriage return at the end (e.g. "Cookie: UserAuth=12345678").
        Parameters:
        extraHeaders - the extra headers to send, or null to not send any

      • getExtraHeaders

        public java.lang.String[] getExtraHeaders()
        Gets the extra HTTP headers that have been requested to be sent with each proxied request.
        Returns:
        the extra headers, or null if there are none

      • setExtraQuery

        public void setExtraQuery(java.lang.String extraQuery)
        Sets an extra query string to be sent with each request that is proxied through this class. The string should be simply the extra parameter(s) to send, with no "?" or trailing or leading "&" (e.g. "a=b" or "a=b&c=d").
        Parameters:
        extraQuery - the extra query string to send, or null to send none

      • getExtraQuery

        public java.lang.String getExtraQuery()
        Gets the extra query string that will be sent with each request that is proxied through this class.
        Returns:
        the extra query string which will be sent, or null

      • setExtendedReponse

        public void setExtendedReponse(boolean extendedReponse)
        Sets a flag to indicate if the response contains extended information. If false, a URL String is returned corresponding to the selected view value If true, extended information is returned in a JSON format that can includes a categorised breakdown of scores and priorities (if applicable).
        Parameters:
        extendedReponse - true or false

      • getExtendedReponse

        public boolean getExtendedReponse()
        Get the flag that indicates if a simple or extended response will be returned.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • performTest

        public java.lang.String performTest(java.lang.String url)
                             throws SCIException
        Perform a Sitemorse test of the specified URL. Only the specific host name identified in the URL itself will be proxied, all other host names will be connected to directly by the Sitemorse test server. The "snapshot-view" version of the results will be used.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to test.
        Returns:
        The URL of the finished report to display to the user.
        Throws:
        SCIException

      • performTest

        public java.lang.String performTest(java.lang.String url,
                                    java.lang.String view)
                             throws SCIException
        Perform a Sitemorse test of the specified URL. Only the specific host name identified in the URL itself will be proxied, all other host names will be connected to directly by the Sitemorse test server.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to test.
        view - The view that should be displayed to the user when the test is complete. This must be one of "report", "snapshot-page" or "snapshot-source".
        Returns:
        The URL of the finished report to display to the user.
        Throws:
        SCIException

      • performTest

        public java.lang.String performTest(java.lang.String url,
                                    java.lang.String[] hostNames)
                             throws SCIException
        Perform a Sitemorse test of the specified URL. All the specified host names will be proxied via the SCI client. Note that the host name indicated by the URL should be included in the host names list. The "snapshot-view" version of the results will be used.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to test.
        hostNames - An array of host names to proxy.
        Returns:
        The URL of the finished report to display to the user.
        Throws:
        SCIException

      • performTest

        public java.lang.String performTest(java.lang.String url,
                                    java.lang.String[] hostNames,
                                    java.lang.String view)
                             throws SCIException
        Perform a Sitemorse test of the specified URL. All the specified host names will be proxied via the SCI client. Note that the host name indicated by the URL should be included in the host names list.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to test.
        hostNames - An array of host names to proxy.
        view - The view that should be displayed to the user when the test is complete. This must be one of "report", "snapshot-page" or "snapshot-source".
        Returns:
        The URL of the finished report to display to the user.
        Throws:
        SCIException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        A test method which allows us to execute this class as an application to see it in action.
        Parameters:
        args - No arguments are required.
